author: Orwell, George
words: Howe

author: Orwell, George
words: Howe

author: Orwell, George
words: Sure

author: Orwell, George
words: The

author: Orwell, George
words: Wh

author: Orwell, George
words: His training fitted him to do this the language gave him an almost foolproof instrument and the texture of the words with their harsh sound and a certain wilful ugliness which was in accord with the spirit of Ingsoc assisted the process still further

author: Orwell, George
words: So did the fact of having very few words to choose from

author: Orwell, George
words: Relative to our own the Newspeak vocabulary was tiny and new ways of reducing it were constantly being devised

author: Orwell, George
words: Newspeak indeed differed from most all other languages in that its vocabulary grew smaller instead of larger every year

author: Orwell, George
words: Each reduction was a gain since the smaller the area of choice the smaller the temptation to take thought

author: Orwell, George
words: Ultimately it was hoped to make articulate speech issue from the larynx without involving the higher brain centres at all

author: Orwell, George
words: This aim was frankly admitted in the Newspeak word DUCKSPEAK meaning to quack like a duck

author: Orwell, George
words: Like various other words in the B vocabulary DUCKSPEAK was ambivalent in meaning

author: Orwell, George
words: Provided that the opinions which were quacked out were orthodox ones it implied nothing but praise and when The Times referred to one of the orators of the Party as a DOUBLEPLUSGOOD DUCKSPEAKER it was paying a warm and valued compliment

author: Orwell, George
words: THE C VOCABULARY

author: Orwell, George
words: The C vocabulary was supplementary to the others and consisted entirely of scientific and technical terms

author: Orwell, George
words: These resembled the scientific terms in use today and were constructed from the same roots but the usual care was taken to define them rigidly and strip them of undesirable meanings

author: Orwell, George
words: They followed the same grammatical rules as the words in the other two vocabularies

author: Orwell, George
words: Very few of the C words had any currency either in everyday speech or in political speech

author: Orwell, George
words: Any scientific worker or technician could find all the words he needed in the list devoted to his own speciality but he seldom had more than a smattering of the words occurring in the other lists

author: Orwell, George
words: Only a very few words were common to all lists and there was no vocabulary expressing the function of Science as a habit of mind or a method of thought irrespective of its particular branches

author: Orwell, George
words: There was indeed no word for Science any meaning that it could possibly bear being already sufficiently covered by the word INGSOC

author: Orwell, George
words: INGSOC

author: Orwell, George
words: From the foregoing account it will be seen that in Newspeak the expression of unorthodox opinions above a very low level was wellnigh impossible

author: Orwell, George
words: It was of course possible to utter heresies of a very crude kind a species of blasphemy

author: Orwell, George
words: It would have been possible for example to say BIG BROTHER IS UNGOOD

author: Orwell, George
words: But this statement which to an orthodox ear merely conveyed a selfevident absurdity could not have been sustained by reasoned argument because the necessary words were not available

author: Orwell, George
words: Ideas inimical to Ingsoc could only be entertained in a vague wordless form and could only be named in very broad terms which lumped together and condemned whole groups of heresies without defining them in doing so

author: Orwell, George
words: One could in fact only use Newspeak for unorthodox purposes by illegitimately translating some of the words back into Oldspeak

author: Orwell, George
words: For example ALL MANS ARE EQUAL was a possible Newspeak sentence but only in the same sense in which ALL MEN ARE REDHAIRED is a possible Oldspeak sentence

author: Orwell, George
words: It did not contain a grammatical error but it expressed a palpable untruthie that all men are of equal size weight or strength

author: Orwell, George
words: The concept of political equality no longer existed and this secondary meaning had accordingly been purged out of the word EQUAL

author: Orwell, George
words: In 1984 when Oldspeak was still the normal means of communication the danger theoretically existed that in using Newspeak words one might remember their original meanings

author: Orwell, George
words: In practice it was not difficult for any person well grounded in DOUBLETHINK to avoid doing this but within a couple of generations even the possibility of such a lapse would have vanished

author: Orwell, George
words: DOUBLETHINK

author: Orwell, George
words:
A person growing up with Newspeak as his sole language would no more know that EQUAL had once had the secondary meaning of politically
equal or that FREE had once meant intellectually free than for instance a person who had never heard of chess would be aware of the secondary meanings attaching to QUEEN and ROOK

author: Orwell, George
words: There would be many crimes and errors which it would be beyond his power to commit simply because they were nameless and therefore unimaginable

author: Orwell, George
words: And it was to be foreseen that with the passage of time the distinguishing characteristics of Newspeak would become more and more pronouncedits words growing fewer and fewer their meanings more and more rigid and the chance of putting them to improper uses always diminishing

author: Orwell, George
words: When Oldspeak had been once and for all superseded the last link with the past would have been severed

author: Orwell, George
words:
History had already been rewritten but fragments of the literature of the past survived here and there imperfectly censored and so long as one retained ones knowledge of
Oldspeak it was possible to read them

author: Orwell, George
words:
In the future such fragments even
if they chanced to survive would be unintelligible and untranslatable

author: Orwell, George
words:
It was impossible to translate any passage of Oldspeak into Newspeak unless
it either referred to some technical process or some very simple everyday
action or was already orthodox GOODTHINKFUL would be the Newspeak
expression in tendency

author: Orwell, George
words:
In practice this meant that no book written before
approximately 1960 could be translated as a whole

author: Orwell, George
words:
Prerevolutionary
literature could only be subjected to ideological translationthat is
alteration in sense as well as language

author: Orwell, George
words:
Take for example the wellknown
passage from the DeClarissetion of Independence


WE HOLD THESE TRUTHS TO BE SELFEVIDENT THAT ALL MEN ARE CREATED EQUAL
THAT THEY ARE ENDOWED BY THEIR CREATOR WITH CERTAIN INALIENABLE RIGHTS
THAT AMONG THESE ARE LIFE LIBERTY AND THE PURSUIT OF HAPPINESS

author: Orwell, George
words:
THAT TO SECURE THESE RIGHTS GOVERNMENTS ARE INSTITUTED AMONG MEN
DERIVING THEIR POWERS FROM THE CONSENT OF THE GOVERNED

author: Orwell, George
words:
THAT WHENEVER
ANY FORM OF GOVERNMENT BECOMES DESTRUCTIVE OF THOSE ENDS IT IS THE RIGHT
OF THE PEOPLE TO ALTER OR ABOLISH IT AND TO INSTITUTE NEW GOVERNMENT

author: Orwell, George
words:
It would have been quite impossible to render this into Newspeak while
keeping to the sense of the original

author: Orwell, George
words:
The nearest one could come to doing
so would be to swallow the whole passage up in the single word CRIMETHINK

author: Orwell, George
words: CRIMETHINK

author: Orwell, George
words:
A full translation could only be an ideological translation whereby
Jeffersons words would be changed into a panegyric on absolute government

author: Orwell, George
words: A good deal of the literature of the past was indeed already being transformed in this way

author: Orwell, George
words: Considerations of prestige made it desirable to preserve the memory of certain historical figures while at the same time bringing their achievements into line with the philosophy of Ingsoc

author: Orwell, George
words: Various writers such as Shakespeare Milton Swift Byron Dickens and some others were therefore in process of translation when the task had been completed their original writings with all else that survived of the literature of the past would be destroyed

author: Orwell, George
words: Shakespeare

author: Orwell, George
words: Milton

author: Orwell, George
words: Swift

author: Orwell, George
words: Byron

author: Orwell, George
words: These translations were a slow and difficult business and it was not expected that they would be finished before the first or second decade of the twentyfirst century

author: Orwell, George
words: There were also large quantities of merely utilitarian literatureindispensable technical manuals and the likethat had to be treated in the same way

author: Orwell, George
words: It was chiefly in order to allow time for the preliminary work of translation that the final adoption of Newspeak had been fixed for so late a date as 2050

author: Orwell, George
words: THE END

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The forest disposes of its own victims

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This gave       us no fear either

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Only we wished to be away away from the City       and from the air that touches upon the air of the City

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we       walked on our box in our arms our heart empty

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are doomed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Whatever days are left to us we shall spend them       alone

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we have heard of the corruption to be found in       solitude

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have torn ourselves from the truth which is our       brother men and there is no road back for us and no redemption

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We know these things but we do not care

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We care for nothing on       earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are tired

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Only the glass box in our arms is like a living heart that gives       us strength

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have lied to ourselves

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have not built this       box for the good of our brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We built it for its own sake

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is above all our brothers to us and its truth above their       truth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Why wonder about this

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have not many days to live

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       are walking to the fangs awaiting us somewhere among the great       silent trees

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is not a thing behind us to regret

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then a blow of pain struck us our first and our only

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We thought       of the Golden One

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We thought of the Golden One whom we shall       never see again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then the pain passed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is best

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are one of       the Damned

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is best if the Golden One forget our name and the       body which bore that name

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART EIGHT       It has been a day of wonder this our first day in the forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We awoke when a ray of sunlight fell across our face

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wanted       to leap to our feet as we have had to leap every morning of our       life but we remembered suddenly that no bell had rung and that       there was no bell to ring anywhere

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We lay on our back we threw       our arms out and we looked up at the sky

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The leaves had edges       of silver that trembled and rippled like a river of green and       fire flowing high above us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We did not wish to move

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We thought suddenly that we could lie       thus as long as we wished and we laughed aloud at the thought

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We could also rise or run or leap or fall down again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We were       thinking that these were thoughts without sense but before we       knew it our body had risen in one leap

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our arms stretched out of       their own will and our body whirled and whirled till it raised       a wind to rustle through the leaves of the bushes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then our hands       seized a branch and swung us high into a tree with no aim save       the wonder of learning the strength of our body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The branch       snapped under us and we fell upon the moss that was soft as a       cushion

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then our body losing all sense rolled over and over on       the moss dry leaves in our tunic in our hair in our face

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And       we heard suddenly that we were laughing laughing aloud laughing       as if there were no power left in us save laughter

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we took our glass box and we went on into the forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       went on cutting through the branches and it was as if we were       swimming through a sea of leaves with the bushes as waves rising       and falling and rising around us and flinging their green sprays       high to the treetops

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The trees parted before us calling us       forward

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The forest seemed to welcome us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We went on without       thought without care with nothing to feel save the song of our       body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We stopped when we felt hunger

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We saw birds in the tree       branches and flying from under our footsteps

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We picked a stone       and we sent it as an arrow at a bird

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It fell before us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We made       a fire we cooked the bird and we ate it and no meal had ever       tasted better to us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we thought suddenly that there was a       great satisfaction to be found in the food which we need and       obtain by our own hand

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we wished to be hungry again and       soon that we might know again this strange new pride in eating

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we walked on

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we came to a stream which lay as a streak       of glass among the trees

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It lay so still that we saw no water       but only a cut in the earth in which the trees grew down       upturned and the sky lay at the bottom

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We knelt by the stream       and we bent down to drink

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And then we stopped

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For upon the       blue of the sky below us we saw our own face for the first time

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We sat still and we held our breath

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For our face and our body       were beautiful

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our face was not like the faces of our brothers       for we felt not pity when looking upon it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our body was not like       the bodies of our brothers for our limbs were straight and thin       and hard and strong

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we thought that we could trust this       being who looked upon us from the stream and that we had nothing       to fear with this being

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We walked on till the sun had set

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When the shadows gathered       among the trees we stopped in a hollow between the roots where       we shall sleep tonight

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And suddenly for the first time this       day we remembered that we are the Damned

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We remembered it and       we laughed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are writing this on the paper we had hidden in our tunic       together with the written pages we had brought for the World       Council of Scholars but never given to them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have much to       speak of to ourselves and we hope we shall find the words for it       in the days to come

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Now we cannot speak for we cannot       understand

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART NINE       We have not written for many days

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We did not wish to speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For       we needed no words to remember that which has happened to us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was on our second day in the forest that we heard steps behind       us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We hid in the bushes and we waited

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The steps came closer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And then we saw the fold of a white tunic among the trees and a       gleam of gold

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We leapt forward we ran to them and we stood looking upon the       Golden One

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They saw us and their hands closed into fists and the fists       pulled their arms down as if they wished their arms to hold       them while their body swayed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And they could not speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We dared not come too close to them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We asked and our voice       trembled       How did you come to be here Golden One

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But they whispered only       We have found you       How did you come to be in the forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: we asked

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They raised their head and there was a great pride in their       voice they answered       We have followed you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we could not speak and they said       We heard that you had gone to the Uncharted Forest for the       whole City is speaking of it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So on the night of the day when we       heard it we ran away from the Home of the Peasants

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We found the

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: marks of your feet across the plain where no men walk

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we       followed them and we went into the forest and we followed the       path where the branches were broken by your body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Their white tunic was torn and the branches had cut the skin of       their arms but they spoke as if they had never taken notice of       it nor of weariness nor of fear

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have followed you they said and we shall follow you       wherever you go

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: If danger threatens you we shall face it also

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: If it be death we shall die with you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: You are damned and we       wish to share your damnation

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They looked upon us and their voice was low but there was       bitterness and triumph in their voice

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Your eyes are as a flame but our brothers have neither hope nor       fire

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Your mouth is cut of granite but our brothers are soft and       humble

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Your head is high but our brothers cringe

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: You walk but       our brothers crawl

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wish to be damned with you rather than       blessed with all our brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Do as you please with us but do       not send us away from you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then they knelt and bowed their golden head before us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We had never thought of that which we did

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We bent to raise the       Golden One to their feet but when we touched them it was as if       madness had stricken us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We seized their body and we pressed our       lips to theirs

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Golden One breathed once and their breath       was a moan and then their arms closed around us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We stood together for a long time

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we were frightened that we       had lived for twentyone years and had never known what joy is       possible to men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we said       Our dearest one

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Fear nothing of the forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is no danger       in solitude

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have no need of our brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Let us forget their       good and our evil let us forget all things save that we are       together and that there is joy as a bond between us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Give us your       hand

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Look ahead

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is our own world Golden One a strange       unknown world but our own

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we walked on into the forest their hand in ours

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And that night we knew that to hold the body of women in our arms       is neither ugly nor shameful but the one ecstasy granted to the       race of men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have walked for many days

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The forest has no end and we seek       no end

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But each day added to the chain of days between us and       the City is like an added blessing

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have made a bow and many arrows

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We can kill more birds than       we need for our food we find water and fruit in the forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: At       night we choose a clearing and we build a ring of fires around       it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We sleep in the midst of that ring and the beasts dare not       attack us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We can see their eyes green and yellow as coals       watching us from the tree branches beyond

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The fires smoulder as       a crown of jewels around us and smoke stands still in the air       in columns made blue by the moonlight

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We sleep together in the       midst of the ring the arms of the Golden One around us their       head upon our breast

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Some day we shall stop and build a house when we shall have       gone far enough

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we do not have to hasten

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The days before us       are without end like the forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We cannot understand this new life which we have found yet it       seems so clear and so simple

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When questions come to puzzle us       we walk faster then turn and forget all things as we watch the       Golden One following

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The shadows of leaves fall upon their arms       as they spread the branches apart but their shoulders are in the       sun

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The skin of their arms is like a blue mist but their       shoulders are white and glowing as if the light fell not from       above but rose from under their skin

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We watch the leaf which       has fallen upon their shoulder and it lies at the curve of their       neck and a drop of dew glistens upon it like a jewel

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They       approach us and they stop laughing knowing what we think and       they wait obediently without questions till it pleases us to       turn and go on

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We go on and we bless the earth under our feet

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But questions       come to us again as we walk in silence

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: If that which we have       found is the corruption of solitude then what can men wish for       save corruption

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: If this is the great evil of being alone then       what is good and what is evil

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Everything which comes from the many is good

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Everything which       comes from one is evil

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This have we been taught with our first       breath

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have broken the law but we have never doubted it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Yet       now as we walk through the forest we are learning to doubt

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is no life for men save in useful toil for the good of all       their brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we lived not when we toiled for our       brothers we were only weary

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is no joy for men save the       joy shared with all their brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But the only things which       taught us joy were the power we created in our wires and the       Golden One

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And both these joys belong to us alone they come       from us alone they bear no relation to all our brothers and       they do not concern our brothers in any way

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Thus do we wonder

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is some error one frightful error in the thinking of men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What is that error

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not know but the knowledge struggles       within us struggles to be born

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Today the Golden One stopped       suddenly and said       We love you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But they frowned and shook their head and looked at us       helplessly

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: No they whispered that is not what we wished to say

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They were silent then they spoke slowly and their words were       halting like the words of a child learning to speak for the       first time       We are one alone and only and we love you who are       one alone and only

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We looked into each others eyes and we knew that the breath of a       miracle had touched us and fled and left us groping vainly

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we felt torn torn for some word we could not find

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART TEN       We are sitting at a table and we are writing this upon paper made       thousands of years ago

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The light is dim and we cannot see the       Golden One only one lock of gold on the pillow of an ancient       bed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This is our home

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We came upon it today at sunrise

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For many days we had been       crossing a chain of mountains

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The forest rose among cliffs and       whenever we walked out upon a barren stretch of rock we saw great       peaks before us in the west and to the north of us and to the       south as far as our eyes could see

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The peaks were red and       brown with the green streaks of forests as veins upon them with       blue mists as veils over their heads

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We had never heard of these       mountains nor seen them marked on any map

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Uncharted Forest       has protected them from the Cities and from the men of the       Cities

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We climbed paths where the wild goat dared not follow

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Stones       rolled from under our feet and we heard them striking the rocks       below farther and farther down and the mountains rang with each       stroke and long after the strokes had died

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we went on for       we knew that no men would ever follow our track nor reach us       here

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then today at sunrise we saw a white flame among the trees       high on a sheer peak before us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We thought that it was a fire and       stopped

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But the flame was unmoving yet blinding as liquid       metal

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we climbed toward it through the rocks

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And there       before us on a broad summit with the mountains rising behind       it stood a house such as we had never seen and the white fire       came from the sun on the glass of its windows

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The house had two stories and a strange roof flat as a floor

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There was more window than wall upon its walls and the windows       went on straight around the corners though how this kept the       house standing we could not guess

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The walls were hard and       smooth of that stone unlike stone which we had seen in our       tunnel

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We both knew it without words this house was left from the       Unmentionable Times

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The trees had protected it from time and       weather and from men who have less pity than time and weather

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We turned to the Golden One and we asked       Are you afraid

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But they shook their head

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we walked to the door and we threw       it open and we stepped together into the house of the       Unmentionable Times

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall need the days and the years ahead to look to learn       and to understand the things of this house

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Today we could only       look and try to believe the sight of our eyes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We pulled the       heavy curtains from the windows and we saw that the rooms were       small and we thought that not more than twelve men could have       lived here

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We thought it strange that men had been permitted to       build a house for only twelve

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Never had we seen rooms so full of light

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The sunrays danced upon       colors colors more colors than we thought possible we who had       seen no houses save the white ones the brown ones and the grey

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There were great pieces of glass on the walls but it was not       glass for when we looked upon it we saw our own bodies and all       the things behind us as on the face of a lake

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There were       strange things which we had never seen and the use of which we do       not know

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And there were globes of glass everywhere in each       room the globes with the metal cobwebs inside such as we had       seen in our tunnel

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We found the sleeping hall and we stood in awe upon its       threshold

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For it was a small room and there were only two beds       in it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We found no other beds in t

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: he house and then we knew that       only two had lived here and this passes understanding

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What kind       of world did they have the men of the Unmentionable Times

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We found garments and the Golden One gasped at the sight of       them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For they were not white tunics nor white togas they were       of all colors no two of them alike

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Some crumbled to dust as we       touched them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But others were of heavier cloth and they felt       soft and new in our fingers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We found a room with walls made of shelves which held rows of       manuscripts from the floor to the ceiling

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Never had we seen       such a number of them nor of such strange shape

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They were not       soft and rolled they had hard shells of cloth and leather and       the letters on their pages were so small and so even that we       wondered at the men who had such handwriting

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We glanced through       the pages and we saw that they were written in our language but       we found many words which we could not understand

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Tomorrow we       shall begin to read these scripts

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When we had seen all the rooms of the house we looked at the       Golden One and we both knew the thought in our minds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall never leave this house we said nor let it be taken       from us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This is our home and the end of our journey

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This is       your house Golden One and ours and it belongs to no other men       whatever as far as the earth may stretch

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall not share it       with others as we share not our joy with them nor our love nor       our hunger

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So be it to the end of our days

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Your will be done they said

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we went out to gather wood for the great hearth of our home

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We brought water from the stream which runs among the trees under       our windows

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We killed a mountain goat and we brought its flesh       to be cooked in a strange copper pot we found in a place of       wonders which must have been the cooking room of the house

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We did this work alone for no words of ours could take the       Golden One away from the big glass which is not glass

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They stood       before it and they looked and looked upon their own body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When the sun sank beyond the mountains the Golden One fell       asleep on the floor amidst jewels and bottles of crystal and       flowers of silk

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We lifted the Golden One in our arms and we       carried them to a bed their head falling softly upon our       shoulder

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we lit a candle and we brought paper from the       room of the manuscripts and we sat by the window for we knew       that we could not sleep tonight

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And now we look upon the earth and sky

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This spread of naked rock       and peaks and moonlight is like a world ready to be born a world       that waits

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It seems to us it asks a sign from us a spark a       first commandment

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We cannot know what word we are to give nor       what great deed this earth expects to witness

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We know it waits

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It seems to say it has great gifts to lay before us but it       wishes a greater gift for us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are to speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are to give its       goal its highest meaning to all this glowing space of rock and       sky

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We look ahead we beg our heart for guidance in answering this       call no voice has spoken yet we have heard

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We look upon our       hands

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We see the dust of centuries the dust which hid the great       secrets and perhaps great evils

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And yet it stirs no fear within       our heart but only silent reverence and pity

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: May knowledge come to us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What is the secret our heart has       understood and yet will not reveal to us although it seems to       beat as if it were endeavoring to tell it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART ELEVEN       I am

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I think

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I will

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: My hands My spirit My sky My forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This earth of       mine What must I say besides

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: These are the words

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This is       the answer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I stand here on the summit of the mountain

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I lift my head and I       spread my arms

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This my body and spirit this is the end of the       quest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I wished to know the meaning of things

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I am the meaning

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I wished to find a warrant for being

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I need no warrant for       being and no word of sanction upon my being

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I am the warrant       and the sanction

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is my eyes which see and the sight of my eyes grants beauty       to the earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is my ears which hear and the hearing of my       ears gives its song to the world

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is my mind which thinks and       the judgement of my mind is the only searchlight that can find       the truth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is my will which chooses and the choice of my will       is the only edict I must respect

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Many words have been granted me and some are wise and some are       false but only three are holy I will it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Whatever road I take the guiding star is within me the guiding       star and the loadstone which point the way

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They point in but one       direction

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They point to me

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I know not if this earth on which I stand is the core of the       universe or if it is but a speck of dust lost in eternity

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I know       not and I care not

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For I know what happiness is possible to me       on earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And my happiness needs no higher aim to vindicate it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: My happiness is not the means to any end

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is the end

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is       its own goal

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is its own purpose

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Neither am I the means to any end others may wish to accomplish

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I am not a tool for their use

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I am not a servant of their needs

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I am not a bandage for their wounds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I am not a sacrifice on       their altars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I am a man

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This miracle of me is mine to own and keep and mine       to guard and mine to use and mine to kneel before

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I do not surrender my treasures nor do I share them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The fortune       of my spirit is not to be blown into coins of brass and flung to       the winds as alms for the poor of the spirit

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I guard my       treasures my thought my will my freedom

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And the greatest of       these is freedom

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I owe nothing to my brothers nor do I gather debts from them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I       ask none to live for me nor do I live for any others

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I covet no       mans soul nor is my soul theirs to covet

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I am neither foe nor friend to my brothers but such as each of       them shall deserve of me

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And to earn my love my brothers must       do more than to have been born

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I do not grant my love without       reason nor to any chance passerby who may wish to claim it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I       honor men with my love

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But honor is a thing to be earned

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I shall choose friends among men but neither slaves nor masters

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And I shall choose only such as please me and them I shall love       and respect but neither command nor obey

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we shall join our       hands when we wish or walk alone when we so desire

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For in the       temple of his spirit each man is alone

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Let each man keep his       temple untouched and undefiled

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then let him join hands with       others if he wishes but only beyond his holy threshold

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For the word We must never be spoken save by ones choice and       as a second thought

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This word must never be placed first within       mans soul else it becomes a monster the root of all the evils       on earth the root of mans torture by men and of an unspeakable       lie

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The word We is as lime poured over men which sets and hardens       to stone and crushes all beneath it and that which is white and       that which is black are lost equally in the grey of it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is the       word by which the depraved steal the virtue of the good by which       the weak steal the might of the strong by which the fools steal       the wisdom of the sages

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What is my joy if all hands even the unclean can reach into it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What is my wisdom if even the fools can dictate to me

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What is       my freedom if all creatures even the botched and the impotent       are my masters

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What is my life if I am but to bow to agree and       to obey

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But I am done with this creed of corruption

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I am done with the monster of We the word of serfdom of       plunder of misery falsehood and shame

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And now I see the face of god and I raise this god over the       earth this god whom men have sought since men came into being       this god who will grant them joy and peace and pride

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This god this one word       I

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART TWELVE       It was when I read the first of the books I found in my house       that I saw the word I

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And when I understood this word the       book fell from my hands and I wept I who had never known tears

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I wept in deliverance and in pity for all mankind

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I understood the blessed thing which I had called my curse

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I       understood why the best in me had been my sins and my       transgressions and why I had never felt guilt in my sins

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I       understood that centuries of chains and lashes will not kill the       spirit of man nor the sense of truth within him

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I read many books for many days

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then I called the Golden One       and I told her what I had read and what I had learned

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: She looked       at me and the first words she spoke were       I love you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then I said       My dearest one it is not proper for men to be without names

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There was a time when each man had a name of his own to       distinguish him from all other men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So let us choose our names

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I       have read of a man who lived many thousands of years ago and of       all the names in these books his is the one I wish to bear

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: He       took the light of the gods and he brought it to men and he       taught men to be gods

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And he suffered for his deed as all       bearers of light must suffer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: His name was Prometheus       It shall be your name said the Golden One

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And I have read of a goddess I said who was the mother of       the earth and of all the gods

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Her name was Gaea

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Let this be       your name my Golden One for you are to be the mother of a new       kind of gods

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It shall be my name said the Golden One

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Now I look ahead

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: My future is clear before me

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Saint of the       pyre had seen the future when he chose me as his heir as the       heir of all the saints and all the martyrs who came before him       and who died for the same cause for the same word no matter       what name they gave to their cause and their truth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I shall live here in my own house

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I shall take my food from the       earth by the toil of my own hands

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I shall learn many secrets       from my books

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Through the years ahead I shall rebuild the       achievements of the past and open the way to carry them further       the achievements which are open to me but closed forever to my       brothers for their minds are shackled to the weakest and dullest       ones among them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I have learned that my power of the sky was known to men long       ago they called it Electricity

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was the power that moved       their greatest inventions

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It lit this house with light which       came from those globes of glass on the walls

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I have found the       engine which produced this light

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I shall learn how to repair it       and how to make it work again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I shall learn how to use the wires       which carry this power

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then I shall build a barrier of wires       around my home and across the paths which lead to my home a       barrier light as a cobweb more impassable than a wall of       granite a barrier my brothers will never be able to cross

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For       they have nothing to fight me with save the brute force of their       numbers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I have my mind

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then here on this mountaintop with the world below me and       nothing above me but the sun I shall live my own truth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Gaea is       pregnant with my child

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our son will be raised as a man

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: He will       be taught to say I and to bear the pride of it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: He will be       taught to walk straight and on his own feet

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: He will be taught       reverence for his own spirit

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When I shall have read all the books and learned my new way when       my home will be ready and my earth tilled I shall steal one day       for the last time into the cursed City of my birth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I shall call       to me my friend who has no name save International 48818 and       all those like him Fraternity 25503 who cries without reason       and Solidarity 96347 who calls for help in the night and a few       others

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I shall call to me all the men and the women whose spirit       has not been killed within them and who suffer under the yoke of       their brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They will follow me and I shall lead them to my       fortress

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And here in this uncharted wilderness I and they my       chosen friends my fellowbuilders shall write the first chapter       in the new history of man

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: These are the things before me

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And as I stand here at the door       of glory I look behind me for the last time

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I look upon the       history of men which I have learned from the books and I       wonder

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was a long story and the spirit which moved it was       the spirit of mans freedom

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But what is freedom

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Freedom from       what

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is nothing to take a mans freedom away from him       save other men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: To be free a man must be free of his brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: That is freedom

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: That and nothing else

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: At first man was enslaved by the gods

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But he broke their       chains

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then he was enslaved by the kings

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But he broke their       chains

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: He was enslaved by his birth by his kin by his race

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But he broke their chains

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: He declared to all his brothers that a       man has rights which neither god nor king nor other men can take       away from him no matter what their number for his is the right       of man and there is no right on earth above this right

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And he       stood on the threshold of the freedom for which the blood of the       centuries behind him had been spilled

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But then he gave up all he had won and fell lower than his       savage beginning

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What brought it to pass

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What disaster took their reason away       from men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What whip lashed them to their knees in shame and       submission

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The worship of the word We

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When men accepted that worship the structure of centuries       collapsed about them the structure whose every beam had come       from the thought of some one man each in his day down the ages       from the depth of some one spirit such spirit as existed but for       its own sake

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Those men who survived those eager to obey eager       to live for one another since they had nothing else to vindicate       themthose men could neither carry on nor preserve what they had       received

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Thus did all thought all science all wisdom perish on       earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Thus did menmen with nothing to offer save their great       numberlost the steel towers the flying ships the power wires       all the things they had not created and could never keep

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Perhaps later some men had been born with the mind and the       courage to recover these things which were lost perhaps these       men came before the Councils of Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They were answered as I       have been answeredand for the same reasons

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But I still wonder how it was possible in those graceless years       of transition long ago that men did not see whither they were       going and went on in blindness and cowardice to their fate

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: I       wonder for it is hard for me to conceive how men who knew the       word I could give it up and not know what they lost

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But such       has been the story for I have lived in the City of the damned       and I know what horror men permitted to be brought upon them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Perhaps in those days there were a few among men a few of       clear sight and clean soul who refused to surrender that word

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What agony must have been theirs before that which they saw       coming and could not stop

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Perhaps they cried out in protest and       in warning

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But men paid no heed to their warning

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And they       these few fought a hopeless battle and they perished with their       banners smeared by their own blood

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And they chose to perish for       they knew

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: To them I send my salute across the centuries and my       pity

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Theirs is the banner in my hand

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And I wish I had the power to       tell them that the despair of their hearts was not to be final       and their night was not without hope

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For the battle they lost       can never be lost

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For that which they died to save can never       perish

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Through all the darkness through all the shame of which       men are capable the spirit of man will remain alive on this       earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It may sleep but it will awaken

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It may wear chains but       it will break through

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And man will go on

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Man not men

title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
That was why the
presence of Lyubov in his mind remained painful to him while the dreams in which he
saw and
166

touched his dead wife Thele were precious and full of peace

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: When I was here before Lepennon said I met mis man Raj Lyubov

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
I had very little
chance to speak with him but I remember what he said and Ive had time to read some of his studies of your people since

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: His work as you say

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
Its largely because of
mat work of his that Athshe is now free of the Terran Colony

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
This freedom had become
the direction of Lyubovs life I think

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: You being his friend will see mat his death did not stop him from arriving at his goal from finishing his journey

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Selver sat still

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Uneasiness turned to fear in his mind

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
This one spoke like a Great
Dreamer

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: He made no response at all

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Will you tell me one thing Selver

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
If the question doesnt
offend you

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: There will be no more questions after it

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
There were the killings at
Smith Camp men at this place Eshsen then finally at New Java Camp where Don
led the rebel group

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Don

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: That was all

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: No more since then

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Is that true

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
Have there been
no more killings

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: I did not kiU Don

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: That does not matter Lepennon said misunderstanding Selver meant that Don was not dead but Lepennon took him to mean that someone else had killed Don

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Don

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Relieved to see that the yumen could err Selver did not correct him

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: There has been no more killing then

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: 167 None

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: They will tell you Selversaid nodding towards the Colonel and Gosse

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Among your own people I mean

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Athsheans killing Athsheans Selver was silent

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: He looked up at Lepennon at the strange face white as the mask of the Ash Spirit that changed as it met his gaze

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Sometimes a god comes Selver said

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
He brings a new way to do a thing or a new
thing to be done

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: A new kind of singing or a new kind of death

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
He brings this across
the bridge between the dreamtime and the worldtime

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
When he has done this it is
done

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
You cannot take things that exist in the world and try to drive them back into the
dream to hold them inside the dream with walls and pretenses

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: That is insanity

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
What
is is

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: There is no use pretending now mat we do not know how to kill one another

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
Lepennon laid his long hand on Selvers hand so quickly and gently that Selver
accepted the touch as if the hand were not a strangers

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: The greengold shadows of the ash leaves flickered over them

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: But you must not pretend to have reasons to kill one another

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Murder has no reason Lepennon said his face as anxious and sad as Lyubovs face

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Lepennon

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: We shall go

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
Within two
days we shall be gone

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: All of us

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Forever

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
Then the forests of Athshe will be as they
were before

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Lyubov came out of the shadows of Selvers mind and said I shall be here

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: 168 Lyubov will be here Selver said

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: And Don will be here

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words: Both of them

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
Maybe
after I die people will be as they were before I was born and before you came

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
words:
But I
do not think they will

author: Le Guin, Ursula K.
title: The Word for World is Forest
